attributes.action: Yarl's Wood should be closed down as unfit for purpose.
attributes.background: Hunger strikes, women put on planes in their nighties, children being reclassified as over 18.  This is a national shame.  Yarl's Wood has been an open sore for years now, the Sky News story,  'Immigration Centre Detainees 'treated like pigs'", 2/5/18 is one in a long line of stories
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/home-news/yarls-wood-inside-experience-hunger-strike-immigration-detention-scandal-a8230056.html

https://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/crime/children-fleeing-warzones-being-locked-up-at-yarls-wood-detention-centre-investigation-finds-10337409.html

https://www.independent.co.uk/voices/windrush-generation-scandal-shappi-khorsandi-i-applaud-david-lammy-a8313906.html

attributes.action: Free NHS prescriptions to families of Veterans who receive War Pensions AFCS
attributes.background: Veterans who have been awarded compensation for injuries sustained whilst serving this country are having to pay for NHS prescriptions due to their income being over the benefit rate.There is an employability supplement that equates to the ESA payment yet without the benefits of free healthcare.

attributes.action: To allow Tyler, the Creator back into the United Kingdom
attributes.background: In 2015, Tyler, the Creator (an American rapper) was banned from the United Kingdom on “behaviours unacceptable in the UK.” People make mistakes especially at a young age. What Tyler promotes is music which people adore and has matured as most people do. He's been banned from lyrics he wrote in 2009
attributes.additional_details: Tyler has changed as seen in his new music and album released in 2017, which is appealing to at least many thousands of fans in the United Kingdom and does not promote violence as he does not ever promote or perform those songs. His punishment has been too extreme for someone who has used ill lyrics at a poor time which many other celebrities have used worse. The people of the United Kingdom want to see him perform again.

attributes.action: 2 year prison sentence for carrying knives
attributes.background: Too many of our young bright teenagers are dying needlessly on a daily basis, robbing parents of their children and brothers and sisters losing a loved one. Far too many teenagers are carrying knives, who's only use is for causing injury or death.
attributes.additional_details: Please look at the news every day to see that knife crime is getting out of control, and the government appear to be too weak to take the action necessary to reduce/stop this. Carrying a knife should mean a mandatory 2 year minimum prison term

attributes.action: Automatic British Citizenship for Indefinite Leave to Remainers settled 15 years
attributes.background: My parents immigrated to the UK with my sister and I in 1988. I obtained ILR status in 2001 having lived in the U.K. since aged 2, gone to university and worked here all my life. It’s not fair to have to sit a test and pay £1330 to become Naturalised. Britain has been my home all my life.
attributes.additional_details: I am 31 years old. I have lived in the U.K. for 29 years.  I have had ILR status since 2001 (for 17 years). It is not fair to have to sit a life in the UK test and pay £1330 to become naturalised. I’ve gone to nursery, primary school, secondary school and  University and spent my whole working life in the U.K. The Government even recognise my 9 month old daughter as British so why do I have to pay over the odds when I pay tax and national insurance and have done my whole working life!

attributes.action: Require all toll bridges to treat disabled people equally
attributes.background: The Government must require parity for all disabled people to use toll bridges and roads for free, not just those on Disability Living Allowance. For example, I’m disabled but too old to qualify for disability living allowance which means I can’t use the Dartford river crossing for free.
attributes.additional_details: As a blue badge holder I can go through London without paying the congestion charge surely it should be the same using the Dartford river crossing. This is free for people who receive Disability Living Allowance and has an exemption from paying vehicle tax as a result. However anyone in my position is still required to pay due to being too old to apply for Disability Living Allowance.

attributes.action: Ban the use of high-frequency sonic deterrents against young people
attributes.background:
'Mosquitos' are devices deployed outside shops in public areas, with the aim of deterring loitering. They output high-energy 17400Hz waves, only heard by children and young adults.

This 108-decibel assault is painful, causes headaches, and discriminates against all young people.
attributes.additional_details:
Mosquito use infringes on section 14 (discrimination) of the European Convention on Human Rights and the Human Rights Act 1998. The Council of Europe has recommended in 2010 that it be banned.

Mosquito emissions are irritating, painful, and have been compared to forms of torture.

Kent County Council have already banned these on council-owned buildings - why are the Government not at least doing the same?

attributes.action: Add Lichen sclerosus to the Medical Exemption list
attributes.background: To obtain a Medical Exemption Certificate and get free NHS prescriptions a condition needs to be on the current Medical Exemption list. I feel this list does not go far enough to help those suffering with long-term conditions such as Lichen Sclerosus. A revision could help thousands of people.

attributes.action: Impose a safety check on all animal toys
attributes.background: Animals are just seen as pets to most but to many they are like a family member. Children's toys have to pass a safety check so animal toys should have to too. This issue needs addressing urgently.
attributes.additional_details: There's been many pet deaths caused by pet toys. My friends dog nearly died through playing with a dog toy and my dog was playing tug with one of her toys which the inside was sticking out. A very sharp plastic tube is the only way I can describe it held together with a small piece of sellotape hidden under woven rope. This could have caused my dog serious harm.

attributes.action: If you are an English citizen, you should not have to pay to attend university.
attributes.background: In Scotland, you do not have to pay to attend university, however, English citizens have to pay extortionate amounts just to get education. Without this education, many young people will not get the chances that their futures' deserve. You can change all this with just a vote.

attributes.action: Bring back nit nurse to UK schools send them home till treated and clear 2018
attributes.background:
Sick of nits £££ on products such as treatments and repellents.
Hours spent combing through hair.
Laundry through constant washing.
Kids crying you pulling and tugging to the point you want to shave their head.
attributes.additional_details:
Abroad they still have nit nurses that come to check children’s heads in school regularly, once head lice are found the child is sent home and not allowed to return till rechecked and cleared.
I lived abroad and this works 100%.
Eliminates before it can even start to spread.
Desperate mum of a girl with beautiful long hair that seriously can’t take this anymore.

attributes.action: Start development of a satellite carrier rocket.
attributes.background: During the 1960s a British rocket named Black Arrow was created that was capable of launching payloads into orbit. However, the program was cancelled in order to save money which left the UK the only country to successfully develop and then cancel an indigenous space rocket.
attributes.additional_details:
-Black Arrow was cancelled in order to save cost, however it was a comparatively cheap rocket design.
-All other countries that have successfully developed rocket technologies have continued to develop them further.
-The lack of our own launch system has led us to rely on foreign countries, such as the Russian Soyuz rocket, which we could be prevented from using their equipment if we fall out of favour with their governments.

attributes.action: Increase the driving age to 21
attributes.background: I believe that being able to drive at 17 is far too young and the age limit should be increased to 21 to try and save lives

attributes.action: Let contraceptives be sold over-the-counter
attributes.background: Contraceptives are currently not sold over-the-counter, you have to get a prescription for one. I believe that this should change. Many people require contraceptive pills and other forms of contraception for different reasons, and they have to go through too much hassle. Make pills over the counter!
attributes.additional_details: People need contraceptives. Women and men - regardless of sexuality - need them to stop STIs and unplanned pregnancies. Transgender men who aren't on HRT can use them to stop their periods, and they may have a judgmental family who would treat them harshly if they found out this was why they were getting contraception - especially 13-to-16-year-olds. Making contraceptives over-the-counter will benefit so many people in terms of health and confidentiality, so what are we waiting for?

attributes.action: Introduce new regulations for the development of Artificial Intelligence.
attributes.background: Artificial Intelligence is intelligent behaviour, exhibited by computers. Currently AI is at a primitive stage, home assistants are starting to play a role in our lives, but what they can do for us is limited. I want to see new regulations, for further development of AI and Machine Learning.
attributes.additional_details:
Many experts, including founder of Microsoft, Bill Gates, and Professor Stephen Hawking, have raised concerns over the development of AI. Many in particular believe that, by 2045, the point of Technological Singularity will occur. This means that, if AI is developed, without regulation, it could surpass human intelligence.

AI is useful at the present time, however, continuing to develop this, without limits, is dangerous. Machines will always make mistakes, let's not become inferior to them.

attributes.action: Legally binding target to give men and women equal life expectancy.
attributes.background: End the worst gender inequality of them all - refocus health resources to give men and women equal life expectancy. The ONS states that the average life expectancy is 79 years for men and 83 years for women. This is a shocking discrimination against men, in the most fundamental way - life itself.
attributes.additional_details: The government should re-direct NHS resources to close the 4-year gap. No child should be born to a shorter life simply by being born male. Medical opinion is that there is no basic reason why women should live longer than men - so resources in research, treatment, health education etc. should be focused on men's health until the gap is closed.

attributes.action: Stop asking schools to check the right to work for parents on school visits
attributes.background: Parents accompanying off site visits with schools are classed as volunteers. All workers voluntary or otherwise must have their right to work checked. This requirement for checks involves schools taking a copy of a passport and signing and dating to say it represents the parent.
attributes.additional_details: I am Headteacher in a busy primary school and neither I nor my office staff have time for unnecessary work. This requirement to check adds an additional admin burden for people who in goodwill are supporting the work of the school on a casual and irregular basis. Accompanying off site visits does not constitute work and will not lead to employment. Parents of children who attend a state funded school must have the right to work and residence or their children will not get a place in school.

attributes.action: End Child Maintenance for Shared care parents.
attributes.background: As it currently stands the resident parent can claim Child Maitanence from the other parent based on how many nights they stay with them. For example up to 57 nights per year is what the child maintanence service class as shared care but still the non resident parent has to pay maintanence.
attributes.additional_details: As an example I have a shared care arrangement with my daughters mum who has residency with them, they stay with me Wednesday - Saturday 7.30pm week 1 & Thursday - Saturday 7.30pm week 2. When they are with me they have everything they need E.g own school clothes, daily clothes, footwear Etc. Their mum claims child benefit & child tax credits for them and yet Child Maintanence Service (CMS) still claim I should still be paying more money to their mum. End the Equality for non resident parents!

attributes.action: Stop 'Treatment Without Consent' in the Mental Health Act
attributes.background: If patients with physical illnesses such as cancer can refuse treatment mental health patients should also be able to do the same. The current practice of using the Mental Health Act to force treatment is coercive and a violation of the autonomy of the patient.
attributes.additional_details: The current practice of psychiatry is almost exclusively based on a biochemical model. The outcome of this is that medication is seen as the only credible resort when treating patients suffering from psychotic illness. When patients suffer side effects they are seen as non-compliant and when they stop medication they are placed on CTOs. This violates the patient's autonomy to make decisions for themselves about their treatment.

attributes.action: Law requiring food chains to show the calories on menus.
attributes.background:
All food-service chains with 20 or more locations must post the number of calories in the food and drink items they sell.
This law should be implemented as it allows the public to count the amount of calories they eat. It can also reduce the chances of obesity.

attributes.action: Ban all advertising boards on the side of motorways.
attributes.background: Drivers are constantly being threatened with prosecution if they use mobile phones, smoke, vape or do anything that distracts them from driving. Motorway advertising is specifically designed to distract drivers. Some of them have animation and can be very bright by using neon type lighting.
attributes.additional_details: It is a central argument of the government that distractions such as mobile phones etc can affect the driving ability of road users. The same evidence and research can be used to argue that advertising boards have the same effect and are therefore dangerous.

attributes.action: HMG to advise Her Majesty to remove “Royal” from Borough of Kensington & Chelsea
attributes.background: On the Prime Minister’s advice, Wootton Basset was awarded the title “Royal” as a result of it's dedicated action. If this honour can be awarded it can also be removed. This should apply to Kensington and Chelsea as a result of the action prior to and inaction following the Grenfell Tower tragedy.
attributes.additional_details: It is an affront to British values for Kensington and Chelsea to continue to use the title “Royal”. The council leader has resigned. Responsibility for Grenfell Tower residents has been taken away from the council by HM Government. A public inquiry has been ordered by HM Government.

attributes.action: Protect consumers who order goods that are out of stock at the time.
attributes.background: Consumers currently have the right to a refund if unhappy with goods purchased online. They should have the same right when purchasing goods in a shop where the goods are out of stock at time of purchase; as with an Internet purchase, the consumer can't inspect the goods until they actually arrive.
attributes.additional_details: In the face-to-face scenario, it can happen that the goods are out of stock, the trader asks for payment prior to ordering the goods into stock, the trader receives the goods into stock, the consumer inspects the goods but is unhappy with them, then the trader refuses to refund the consumer’s money, forcing the consumer to either accept the goods or alternatively a credit note that may be of no use to the consumer.  I believe that consumers should have the right to a refund in this situation.

attributes.action: The UK Government should provide financial aid solutions for future pilots
attributes.background: A major factor driving fewer people to take up the career is the cost of training. Aspiring pilots, who aren’t able to secure a place on the limited number of airline sponsored training schemes, need to find large sums of money to pay for their own training costs which can be upwards of £100,000.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.ft.com/content/d7117f1e-d963-11e5-a72f-1e7744c66818

http://www.fta-global.com/fta-news/pilot-shortage-looms-but-uk-and-european-commercial-pilot-licence-issues-are-down

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/av/business-42917181/pilot-shortage-who-s-going-to-fly-our-planes

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-11691204

http://www.travelweekly.co.uk/articles/35126/balpa-warns-of-uk-pilot-shortage

attributes.action: Ban the sale of cigarettes in corner shops, only sell them in the supermarket
attributes.background: This will make younger people hard to buy the cigarette from the corner and this will make them go to the top 4 supermarkets because the supermarket will ask for ID and some corner shop do not ask for ID. This will help more people quit smoking and never start smoking in the first place.

attributes.action: Increase the capacity of prisons by building 5 new prisons by 2022.
attributes.background: Throughout the UK over the last few years the increase of crime has put pressure onto prisons and the justice system. Therefore because there aren't enough spaces in prisons, criminals may get away with crimes they have committed. If more prisons are built, it will create more space for criminals.

attributes.action: Change the British military's standard issue rifle to the C8/L119
attributes.background: The British military's current rifle, the SA80/L85, is completely outclassed by the Colt Canada C8SFW Carbine, with its higher stopping power and rate of fire, already in use by special forces, the Royal Military Police and Royal Marine 43 Commando Fleet Protection Group
attributes.additional_details: Already a proven rifle, the swap would increase the effectiveness of a single infantry soldier in a firefight. The similarities to the US M4 would also allow spare parts to be used between us and our most powerful ally, and allow soldiers to pick up each other's weapons, for whatever reason, and already be used to an extremely similar one.

attributes.action: Increase the number of GCSE options that schools offer
attributes.background: The choices we have for GCSE's can be very limited within schools. In my GCSE choices I only had nine other options, other than the core few. This has limited my possible learning and perhaps my future.
attributes.additional_details: The choices you have limit what is possible in the future for me and others with limited choices.

attributes.action: Make rehabilitation the main aim of a Judge when sentencing criminals.
attributes.background: In the UK, the main aim of Judges while sentencing is a mix of rehabilitation and deterrence, however, I believe that by deciding on one main aim, we could reduce reoffending rates.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.businessinsider.com/why-norways-prison-system-is-so-successful-2014-12?international=true&r=US&IR=T 

The link above will take you to a trusted news website. The selected page is all about how the rehabilitation rates in Switzerland are lower than in America, Therefore, proving our point.

attributes.action: British Citizens must be subject to UK taxation wherever they live in the world
attributes.background: The current system encourages high-earning individuals to leave the UK for tax purposes. This is not in the national interest.

attributes.action: Make it so any employer has to reply to job applications within a month.
attributes.background: Applying for a job and getting no reply is demoralising and can leave you unmotivated to apply for others. If you get no reply, you’re unsure if your CV is bad or if they’re ignoring your application. Therefore, employers should reply to applications within a certain amount of time.
attributes.additional_details: If you’re told that you’re not accepted, then it will help significantly more than being told nothing, as you can then build on your CV / application technique. But when you’re ignored, then you don’t know what is wrong and when it happens with every job you apply for it can seriously damage motivation to apply for more. Therefore I feel it is a right that an applicant reserves; to get a reply - wether it be a yes or no or simply that the role is now fulfilled.

attributes.action: Stop Dartford toll fees.
attributes.background: The authorities said that as soon as the bridge was paid for the fees would stop.

attributes.action:
Higher Minimum Wage for anti-social hours
(11pm-6am).
attributes.background: Sometimes an employer will pay staff who work anti-social hours a higher wage than those who work normal hours, but not very often; especially in the bar industy. Working anti-social hours can put a strain on the health and limits people's chances to join in on family and social life.
attributes.additional_details: Unfortunately, there is no legal entitlement to increased pay for working anti-social hours, and I think this should change! Thanks

attributes.action: Force companies to publish age statistics of their workforce
attributes.background: The UK government predicts that by 2020 a third of workers will be over the age of 50 and by 2039 the state pension age will be 68. Yet despite our ageing workforce, discrimination against older workers is a problem that is likely to worsen.
attributes.additional_details:
The discrimination also occurs in recruitment, where it has a big impact. There is significant research that backs up the fact people over 55 (and especially women) are less likely to get job interviews than younger people.

Many older workers are forced to become self-employed and find contract work to make ends meet when they would prefer to find a permanent job.

Reporting on mean, median and hiring ratios vs applicants would ensure less bias.

attributes.action: Give adoption allowance to self employed people
attributes.background:
If you are employed and pregnant you are entitled to maternity pay.
If you are employed and adopting a child you are entitled to adoption pay.
If you are self employed and pregnant you are entitled to maternity allowance.
If you are self employed and adopting a child you are entitled to NOTHING!!
attributes.additional_details:
Please support people who are self employed and are wanting to provide a loving and stable home for a child in need.
The financial situation is very important in the adoption process as you need to be able to provide for a child emotionally and financially, no adoption allowance can stand in the way of prospective adoptive parents being approved.
Thank you.

attributes.action: Make homework optional/non-compulsory and ban detention and isolation
attributes.background: Homework stresses young minds out. How are children expected to complete 15 pieces of homework a week for it simply to be glanced at? It is unfair for people to be kept in school against their will, but many schools in the UK do this. Action must be taken!

attributes.action: Ban social media that doesnt confirm your age officially or allows you anonymity
attributes.background: Social media is far too often used as a barrier to hide behind and bully others. Snapchat, Facebook, Sarahah, need to start confirming children's ages with official documents and stop allowing users to remain anonymous. Bullying can kill and it must be stopped.

attributes.action: Require all UK betting shops to have security screens to protect staff.
attributes.background: The Gambling Commission recommends such screens but it is down to the Local Authority who issue licences whether or not they are needed. It should be a legal requirement for all Betting Shops to have safety screens. All Betting Shops should have them, like banks and Post Offices do.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for public toilets to have better personal hygiene facilities
attributes.background: Everyday hundred of thousands of Britons use public bathrooms and there is only ever tissue! How can anyone clean them selves properly with just tissue. This also means that hundereds of thousand of Britons are walking around with with feces (harmful bacteria) on their bodies. It needs to change!
attributes.additional_details: more suitable cleaning apparatus EG: a Bidet shower

attributes.action: To get more hospitals and health care centres back in local areas across the UK
attributes.background: Lack of hospitals and health care centres in Hertfordshire is a major issue as the nearest hospital is 18.5 miles and 36 minuets away this is not including traffic and other altercations.
attributes.additional_details: A hard working student striving to be the best at Longdean school was unfortunately caught up in an car accident, it was shocking to all the students and staff at this school, even more shocking was that it took 1 hour and 30 minuets for an ambulance to reach her and luckily she was  not injured and walked away with out a scratch but this was a wake up call to the students at Longdean school, to take action and create this petition.

attributes.action: Amend TUA 2016, so non-union members pay for benefits gained from Union work.
attributes.background:
Benefits negotiated by Trade unions at the workplace are enjoyed by union members & non-members alike.
e.g. Workplace offers 1% pay rise to workforce but through negotiations with trade union, an increased offer of 2.5% is agreed. Members & non-members alike are given a 2.5% pay rise as a result.
attributes.additional_details:
Union members already make financial contribution to support their union to act on their behalf however non-members receive the benefit of this rise without having made any financial contribution to the costs of the union achieving this mutually beneficially outcome.
Make non-union members pay monthly contribution, not exceeding subs paid by union members or they will receive only the 1% payrise.

attributes.action: Lower wait time for new universal credit claims
attributes.background: The current wait time for new universal credit claims is 5 weeks. This means low income families go without money for that period and puts families in severe hardship. Tax credit claims by contrast only take 3 weeks. We need to speed this up to save families from making difficult decisions.

attributes.action: Increase funding and awareness for public transport in the UK.
attributes.background: The UK is well known for being a modern and developed nation, but do we really do all that we can to make our country green? We are falling behind compared to many other countries. This directly affects everyone in the UK so take our country's future into your hands; sign now to have your say.

attributes.action: Delay the introduction of accountable care organisations
attributes.background: Delay the introduction of accountable care organisations till after the Health Committee has the opportunity to review the evidence of their potential impact on the NHS.
attributes.additional_details: ACOs are about saving money and closing services. The Secretary of State for Health needs to refrain from introducing them behind Parliament's back.

attributes.action: Modify the election system for MPs to make it more democratic and representative
attributes.background: Parliament and MPs have lost the respect and trust of the majority of UK citizens. Parliament is perceived as representing MPs, political families and the rich. This applies to all UK political parties. The system of PD has been hijacked by interests from outside the UK with the support of UK MPs.
attributes.additional_details:
Replace the present election system with one that requires 25% of MPs to stand for re-election each year.  Ensure that the list of those needing to stand is random and cannot be fixed by political parties. Ensure all MPs have to stand for re-election during a Parliament.  Publish, in mainstream media, attendance and voting records of all MPs standing for re-election.
 The annual election of a proportion of Local Councillors has worked for many years. It is important to show MPs are honest people

attributes.action: Add ‘RESPECT’ to the National Curriculum from 5 years upwards. Lacking Today.
attributes.background:
Many grow up with little or no respect today, no Respect for Teachers the Police, Property and the Elderly, this is very wrong in this day and age, Some Police only Get Cheek in trying to correct their behaviour and the ones above.

At one time Churches could leave them open, today it’s a No No.
attributes.additional_details:
Many youngsters are Serious Lacking Any Respect today as is Proven, Some attack Teachers and their Assistants, Elderly getting abused and Picked on, when I was young it was Instilled into us ALL at school Never to do Anything Against the Elderly and all the above, we All Respected Them 100%, we would never have thought about causing Damage or Thefts from Churches, today some do, Not all are Bad just a Select few causing Antisocial Behaviour.

Let’s try to correct things and make the Country good

attributes.action: Help single parents into work by funding childcare for all ages during holidays
attributes.background: It is really hard for single parents to work during summer holidays due to the government not funding childcare for all ages, only funding for children under 5 if you spread you nursery hours throughout the year. It is near impossible for a single parent of children under 10 to work 30 hours a week.

attributes.action: Make Staffordshire Bull terriers wear a harness or muzzle in public.
attributes.background:
My pet cat was savaged and killed by a Staffordshire bull terrier whilst the incompetent owner and his partner walked past my premises. 
The dog was not muzzled or in a harness, he was able to slip his lead and collar. The owner who had one arm in a sling at the time was unable to control him.
attributes.additional_details:
I am partially disabled and Ben is my only companion, this has had a devastating effect on my life. 
I reported the incident to the police and the Basildon Echo. 
The police are unable to do anything about it without identifying the owner. 
I have searched the neighbourhood and spoken with many local people but have been unable to find the owner. 
My MP encouraged me to start the petition and has spoken with the police on my behalf.

attributes.action: Streamline UK education by creating a single/governmental exam board
attributes.background: I'm at my 1st year of university. A lot of time is wasted covering content covered at A level; this was also true for A level regarding GCSEs. Why? Because multiple exam boards mean students don't cover the same content, so it has to be taught again at the next level of education.
attributes.additional_details:
One exam board would stop this.

Furthermore, revision resources are poor. But, converting to one exam board will create a single/larger market for people to produce educational content for, meaning it can be higher quality.

E.g. 2 At A-level, I wanted to produce a revision site for A-level STEM subjects, however it is a waste of time because too few students would use it, because there is too much content between the 5 different exam boards.

attributes.action: To have a UK referendum on the colour of the UKGB passport post Brexit.
attributes.background: The government has announced that the UK will be returning to a navy blue passport post Brexit. As Brexit is about building a new future, a return to its navy origins can be considered looking backwards. There should be a choice of colours for people to choose from to represent this new beginning.
attributes.additional_details: https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Color_wheel
